intro: Parajusticia petelotii, commonly known as the Guatemalan flame vine, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces small, round berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates for its vibrant floral display.
